definition: to come directly towards one/top/immediate (superior)

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
one's immediate superior

sentences.english: Your boss is the point where your group attaches to the tree.
sentences.chinese: 你的頂頭上司就是你們組和大樹的聯結點。

sentences.english: The H13 steel piercer point alloyed by Re-Al is studied.
sentences.chinese: 對H13鋼穿孔頂頭進行了稀土鋁合金化研究。

sentences.english: He was unjustly blamed by his immediate supperior.
sentences.chinese: 他受到頂頭上司的錯怪。

sentences.english: He is the head honcho of the company.
sentences.chinese: 他是我們公司的頂頭上司。

sentences.english: Some parameters of the piercing heads and piercing force are given by using UBE method.
sentences.chinese: 頂頭形狀設計是壓力穿孔機理論研究的重要內容。

sentences.english: Four trees were to be seen at its extremity.
The imperial wind what resembles hangs head.
Your first action should be to raise any issues or concerns you have with your line manager.
sentences.chinese: 第一個行動應該是和頂頭上司談論你的問題和擔憂。

sentences.english: Let's go from the top of the page.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們從這頁頂頭開始。

sentences.english: I just remembered to a bunch of higher-ups.
sentences.chinese: 想起來我還要一堆頂頭上司批准的咧。

sentences.english: He leaned over backwards to please his immediate superior.
sentences.chinese: 他拼命討好他的頂頭上司。

sentences.english: The manufacture and process techniques of the wrought Mo alloy piercing mandrel have been introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了變形態鉬合金穿管頂頭的研製及其工藝技術。

definition: to enumerate sb's shortcomings/to criticize/to scold/to talk on and on
number of military unit
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
victor/winner
to anger sb/to enrage
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
workplace overseer/foreman
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to damn/to curse/to revile
a register/land register/account book/ledger
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
pass like thunder and move like the wind (idiom); swift and decisive reaction
to force someone to do something
